description.text:
Abyssinica SIL is based on Ethiopic calligraphic traditions. This release is a regular typeface, with no bold or italic version available or planned.
The goal for this product was to provide a single Unicode-based font that would contain a comprehensive inventory of glyphs needed for almost any Ethiopic-based writing system. In addition, there is provision for other Latin characters and symbols. This font makes use of state-of-the-art font technologies to support the need to position arbitrary combinations of *Ethiopic* base glyphs and combining marks optimally. It also supports almost 200 kerning pairs. This version of the font also supports 14 Stylistic Sets (OpenType) or Features (Graphite) which make glyph alternates available for a number of Ethiopic and punctuation characters. See AbyssinicaSILFontFeatures.pdf for details on applications which support Stylistic Sets and how to access them.
One font from this typeface family is included in this release:
* Abyssinica SIL Regular
For detailed documentation see the contents of the 'documentation' folder.
ChangeLog --------- (This should list both major and minor changes, most recent first.)
13 December 2010 (Lorna Priest) Abyssinica SIL version 1.200 - Updated for Unicode 6.0 (U+AB00..U+AB2F) - Added Stylistic Sets and Graphite Features - does not include AAT support
1 June 2006 (Jonathan Kew) - AAT source added
25 May 2006 (SIL NRSI team) Abyssinica SIL version 1.0 - First version released under the SIL Open Font License
